name: Gansevoort Turks + Caicos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the last 9 mos getting settled in NYC after a lifetime in So Cal and had a lot of steam to blow off to say the least. The property and the staff were amazing. Rarely do vacations live up to the hype, but Turks and Caicos and The Gansevoort exceeded all expectations.
reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!

reviews.text: Was here for Easter week. Been to a few Islands and 1st time at T&C and have to say what a great place the Island is. The Gansevoort resort I would recommend to anyone who is looking for total relaxation and service... from the rooms, food, employees, pool and beach are all 1st class. I can write a long winded review, but all I can say It was a vacation that I didn't want to end and I'll definitely go back.
reviews.title: Total relaxation and great service.

reviews.text: My family just returned from the Gansevoort and had a great time. The location of the hotel is very nice as it is the last hotel on Grace Bay beach. It felt very secluded. The beach is beautiful and we had no problem finding a place to sit. The staff sets up everything you need. The pool is also beautiful but seats were limited and all taken by the time we went down for breakfast at 9:00 am. Very annoying especially because most people did not sit in their "reserved" seats until late afternoon! The hotel was filled to capacity so this may have been the cause of this problem. Also, they have special reserved seats on "islands" in the pool. We never got a straight answer on how we could get one. Even though the hotel was full, it did not seem overly crowded. The breakfast buffet was great. All the food you could ever want! Lunch was so-so. Would have liked to have seen more lunch options. Had dinner at the hotel twice and it was great both times. Also did room service and it was very quick in the delivery and clean up. The rooms (we booked a 2 bedroom suite) were nice and well appointed. They could use some hooks in the bathrooms as we didn't have a place to hang wet towels. Using the shower was confusing and water spilled out of one of the showers due to a slow drain. There was a kids club that was nice for smaller kids. My daughter (age 7) enjoyed painting and getting her hair braided. My son (age 10) did not want anything to do with it. There was a movie night one night and a bonfire one night for the kids. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and eager to please. Some were more on "island time" than others but we expected that. Taxis anywhere on the island were expensive and prices were inconsistent. I think we spent most of our money on taxis and tips! Don't miss Parallel 23 and Bella Luna for dinner.
reviews.title: Great hotel with some minor issues
Absolutely perfect
reviews.text: Stayed there for 6 nights. The hotel is just perfect and the staff is very kind and helpful. You feel l ike in heaven. There is absolutely nothing to complain. The beach is beautiful and the hotel room is spacious and wonderful. Food is good, although a bit boring when you eat there every day, but there are lots of other restaurants a few minutes away and the concierge was always very helpful. Would recommend this hotel to everyone who loves the beach and the sun. Would love to see other hotels like this in the caribbean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first stayed at the Gansevoort in February of this year and liked it so much we came back for a 5 -day Easter break. The island felt very safe so vacation already starts with being greeted at the airport and chauffered in a clean van to the hotel, a quick 10 minute ride from the airport to arrive at the absolutely breathtaking hotel lobby. The view of the gorgeous pool and ocean in the background together with the welcome cocktail in our hands immediately made us feel as if we had never left.. Being greeted by name certainly added to that feeling. The check-in was instant and minutes later we arrived in our beautifully appointed suite. Spacious, crisp and modern -very Gansevoort.
reviews.title: Total Relaxation, a short trip away from NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was picked up at the airport by the hotel's shuttle van and I was blown away by the beauty of this Gansevoort. The pool and beach in horizon is the first thing you see when you pull up. I was greeted by the event coordinator, Ms. Anne-Marie Martinez , who was an amazing hostess and made sure we had an incredible experience. The room was chic, comfortable and bigger then I expected. It included a luxurious bathroom with ceiling shower heads, queen size bed that was hard to leave in the morning and Bose ipod dock which I really appreciated! Breakfast was complimentary and fully satisfying as well as the food in their restaurant Bagatelle. I can't wait to go back this summer. I'm already booked!
reviews.title: Best destination if you like beauty, luxury, and quality service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gansevoort Turks & Caicos is a nice, clean, fun, easy to get to Caribbean resort with good service provided by the staff. I can't see how anybody with an open mind could have a bad time here. To us it wasn't the most amazing or unique spot we have been to but is deserving of a 4 star, or "very good", rating.
reviews.title: Nice Resort - Good Service - Convenient From NYC - We Had Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is about a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport which is nice. I think the recently introduced JetBlue direct flight from NYC to Provo will continue to be a boon for business - it's just a 3 hour flight, then that 10 minute taxi ride, and you're in paradise. The location is a touch removed from some of the other resorts and many of the restaurants you'll want to dine at, though. Cab rides are quick, however, and run about $10 bucks a person it would seem (the price seemed to change a tiny bit depending upon the taxi driver and where you were going).
reviews.title: Heavenly....

reviews.text: We thought the entire place was very clean, seemed pretty new, and overall was well kept. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. A direct view of the ocean is hard to beat.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.text: The pool is very nice, although chairs seemed to be almost fully reserved by about 9am, so word to the wise. If you want your pick of the litter we'd recommend being out there by 8 or 8:30, to plop your books/magazines down, and then go about your morning. Your chairs will be waiting for you when you return.
reviews.title: i can't wait to go back....
one of the best hotels on provo
reviews.text: we had our wedding here last october with 45 of our closest friends and family.

reviews.title: Fabulous as usual!!

reviews.title: Gansevoort - A Concise review

reviews.text: Our trip to TCI was amazing as always. Thanks in most part to our fabulous stay at the Gansevoort Turks and Caicos. The service here is amazing from the moment you walk in to going to eat to the pool, the beach, etc, etc.,etc.....
reviews.title: Greatest girls trip ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was by far the best hotel I have ever been to. the decor was beautiful. I wanted to come home to start looking for an apartment that looks just like the room I was in. I loved everything about it, the shower, the bed, everything was so soft!!! The staff was so friendly; they introduced themselves the first day and addressed you by name everyday after. we never had to look around for anyone; there was always someone checking to see if we needed anything and to make sure we were comfortable and having fun. I can hardly wait to go back. we live in New York and with Jet Blue flying direct it was so easy. you get to enjoy all the days your there instead of traveling half the day.while having dinner one night the chef came out and stopped at every table to say hello. I also loved that there is only ninty-two rooms; it made sitting at the pool really enjoyable;no waking up at seven in the morning to try and get a chair before they were all gone. I could go on and on but to sum it up there just is no need to ever go anywhere else.
reviews.title: what a wonderful place;no need to ever go anywhere else again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family vacation was pure bliss! The service was Impeccable; Room was dreamy, food and ambiance spectacular!!! I highly recommend Gansevoort Turks & Caicos.
reviews.title: AMAZING Family Vacation

reviews.text: I just returned home from the Gansevoort in Turks and Caicos and I loved it so much that it is a MUST for anyone who wants a low-key, relaxing, yet elegant experience. Service was amazing and hotel staff were all extremely friendly. Breathtaking view of the water from all of the Carribean islands I have been to!
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I've stayed at there other properties in Miami and New York and was always happy with the service and accommodations, but the staff in the Turks and Caicos are amazing. Ann Marie made sure we were never in need of anything. Everyroom has a beautiful view of the ocean. I'm so in love with the island and especially the Gansevoort for such an amazing stay. Although we just came back the beginning of April, we've already made plans to return in May for my birthday!!!! I can't wait. Its the perfect place for rest and ultimate relaxation. You won't be disappointed. I think it's the best hotel on the Island.
reviews.title: The Best Vacation Ever!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my second time in 2011...and I plan to keep up the pace for the remainder of the year. 3 hour flight from NYC, and you're in paradise. Great staff, amazing facilities....it's just easy breeezy.
reviews.title: SITTin on a beachbed, sippin Rose...it was straight PIMP

description: Gansevoort Turks + Caicos brings a signature approach to luxury lifestyle that redefines the destination resort experience. Each of the 91 guestrooms offers sweeping ocean views positioned and designed to pay homage to the unspoiled island. The resort blends Caribbean cool with sophisticated style to create a sense of place for our guests.
